title: How Do You Get Rid of Polyps Naturally? Treatments & Remedies
author: Medical Editor John P Cunha; DO; FACOEP
description: Polyps do not always need to be treated and may go away on their own. Natural remedies may be used to relieve symptoms and pain caused by nasal polyps, such as a humidifier, a neti pot, bromelain and probiotic supplements, and avoiding alcohol. Other polyps at risk of becoming cancerous may have to be removed surgically (polypectomy).
cleaned_text: Polyps are abnormal tissue growths that can form on any body part that has mucus membranes. Polyps can be flat or they can project from the tissue by a stalk (pedunculated). [Colon](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/image-gallery/colon_picture/images.htm) polyps are the most common type of polyp. Other common types of polyps include: - Nose/sinuses - Stomach (gastric polyp) - Ear (aural polyp) - Cervix - Uterus - Throat and vocal folds (larynx) Certain types of polyps have the potential to become cancerous. Some types of polyps may not need treatment and may go away on their own. [Nasal polyps](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_sinusitis/article_em.htm) affecting the nose and sinuses are usually not cancerous. There are no home remedies proven to entirely get rid of nasal polyps naturally but natural remedies may be used to improve symptoms and reduce discomfort caused by nasal polyps, such as: - Use a humidifier or inhale - - Take probiotic [supplements](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-multivitamins_and_minerals/article_em.htm)and eat probiotic-rich foods to keep the immune system healthy - Avoid [alcohol](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/alcohol_quiz_iq/quiz.htm) Other polyps carry a risk of becoming cancerous and need to be removed. Surgical removal of polys (polypectomy) is the most common treatment for polyps that cause symptoms or that have the potential to be cancerous. Depending on the location and type of polyp, different or additional treatments may be indicated: - Ear (aural polyps) - Avoiding water in the ear - Steroid medicines - Antibiotic ear drops - Nasal polyps - Nasal [steroids](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/steroids/article_em.htm)or corticosteroid treatments - Nasal - Cervical and uterine polyps - Gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonists - Throat and vocal fold (larynx) Voice therapy (vocal hygiene) - Treat What Are Symptoms of Polyps? Symptoms of polyps depend on their location. Polyps often have no symptoms. When symptoms of colon polyps occur, they may include: - Pain or discomfort in the lower abdomen - Blood in stool [Diarrhea](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/diarrhea/article_em.htm) [Constipation](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/constipation_in_adults/article_em.htm) When symptoms of stomach (gastric) polyps occur, include: [Stomach pain](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/abdominal_pain_in_adults/article_em.htm) [Weight loss](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/weight_loss_and_control/article_em.htm) - Severe [vomiting](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/vomiting_and_nausea/article_em.htm) [Anemia](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/anemia/article_em.htm)due to vomiting Symptoms of ear (aural) polyps may include: - Bloody drainage from the ear [Hearing loss](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/hearing_loss/article_em.htm) Symptoms of nasal polyps may include: - Feelings of fullness or pressure in the face - Stuffy nose - Problems with sense of smell Symptoms of cervical and uterine polyps may include: - Heavy menstrual [bleeding](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/wilderness_bleeding/article_em.htm) - Bleeding between periods [Vaginal discharge](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/vaginal_discharge/article_em.htm)with foul odor (caused by infection) - Bleeding after intercourse - Bleeding after [menopause](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/menopause/article_em.htm) Symptoms of polyps in the throat and vocal folds (larynx) include: - Rough, scratchy, or harsh-sounding voice - Feeling as if a lump is stuck in the throat [Hoarseness](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/laryngitis/article_em.htm) - Breathiness - Shooting pain from ear to ear [Neck pain](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/neck_pain_cervical_pain/article_em.htm) - Decreased ability to change vocal pitch - Voice and body tiredness How Are Polyps Diagnosed? Polyps are diagnosed with physical examination of the affected area, and different types of tests may be used depending on where the polyps are located in the body.
